meanings.definition: A person who has capital, especially extensive capital, invested in business enterprises.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy capitalists owned many factories in the city.
meanings.sent2: The capitalists invested in new technology to grow their businesses.
meanings.sent3: The capitalists joked that their money was so happy in the bank, it never wanted to leave.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a testament to the power of the capitalists' investments.
meanings.sent5: The capitalists' influence in the market was undeniable.

meanings.sent1: The politicians debated the role of capitalists in the economy.
meanings.sent2: Many capitalists believe in the free market system.
meanings.sent3: The group of capitalists at the conference proudly waved their supply and demand flags.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the hero was portrayed as a capitalist fighting for economic freedom.
meanings.sent5: The capitalists' support for competition shaped the market dynamics.
